result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer A Klug was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 4 days were granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: Case 14CF1156

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Spencer A Klug

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation Conditions for Expungement

Received today, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, requesting to have expungement processed. 
NOTE: the Defendant was advised that in order for this request to be considered, the Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation Conditions for Expungement (DOC-2678) must be filed by his probation agent.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Spencer A Klug in court with Attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Counts #1 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Mitchell makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:   WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS (4 Days credit, if revoked)   **CONCURRENT WITH CASE #14CF1156**
 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

RESTITUTION:  $0

COSTS:  $343.00 (includes DV surcharge) (to be paid as a condition of probation)  **Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation**.

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.**

Attorney Mitchell requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Mitchell requests and adjournment as she was just assigned this case.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing on March 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Spencer A Klug in court with Attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Broughton requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Spencer A Klug in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on October 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with his parents or any family member.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defenant may not have contact with mother for 72 hours unless she agrees to waive the 72 hour no contact order.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Spencer A Klug in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not seen by the Public Defender's Office, because he was not brought to the jail until approximatey 10:00 a.m.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
